post_text:
Dear Northside students, parents, and staff,

Today was not the first day of school we imagined. I’m sorry.

I know it’s been a frustrating day as we have all struggled with numerous technical issues. We are still working with our MyNISD Portal vendor to resolve the access issue. This was not simply a matter of a lack of bandwidth or a network failure.

In the meantime, we have a temporary solution that will allow us to get up and running as we had hoped with Schoology. That link was pushed to nisd.net earlier this afternoon.

Please know that we will not count students absent or penalize them for any assignments today because they were not able to access the virtual learning platform.

I appreciate the flexibility and creativity of our teachers, students and parents as they did their best to reach out to allow students to connect today.

As the week unfolds, we will keep you updated with any new information.

It will get better. We will get better. Thank you for your patience.

Dr. Brian T. Woods
Superintendent, Northside ISD

post_text: Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) is a one-time food benefit for families who lost access to free or reduced-price meals due to school closures. Families can receive up to $285 per eligible child. P-EBT food benefits are for children who received SNAP food benefits for March 2020 and children who are certified for free or reduced-price school meals during the 2019-20 Texas school year. Children that attend a school that offers free meals to all students (Community Eligibility Provision) are also eligible. Fill out an application here- yourtexasbenefits.com/Learn/PEBT. The application is open until June 30. For more info,visit hhs.texas.gov/PEBT or call 833-613-6220.
